page.title: 06FARMING (CLARE FARM)
page.content: Mr Hodges is a son of a farmer. On Friday the 10th of May 1985 I went to see him to ask him about his farm (Clare Fm.) The name of his farm was there when they bought it. He says the oldest farm he ever had was in 1914. The animals he owns on his farm are cattle-mainly Friesians. Mr Hodges says its a family business. He took over the farm after his parents in 1942. He started a new dairy unit three years ago and set a figure limit reduction.He says the surplus of produce is a bad thing.he said his farm hasn't really changed in the last 100 years,but it has become more productive.He thinks over the next 100 years we will probably grow more cereals+potatoes and also woodlands for conservation.he thinks the eecgives farmers a broader outlook
